pages.title: Behavior
pages.text: While not as physically strong as $(item)Demons$(), Imps are much more aggressive, naughty and mischievous. Flame Imps can be easily swayed if they have a personal gain.

pages.title: Taming Imps
pages.description: While Imps are notoriously aggressive, they can make a pact with a player.$(br)Give the Imp a $(item)Demonic Contract$() signed with blood (by crafting it with a bound $(l:constructs/misc/taglock_kit)Taglock kit$(/l)) and make sure to have something to trade. $(item)25 Experience Levels$() should suffice.$(p)When tamed, the Flame Imp will protect its master from any hostile entities.

pages.title: Imp Trading
pages.description: An Imp with a bound contract will trade with its master. A player can give the Imp items that it deems valuable, called $(item)Shinies$(). Once enough shinies have been gifted to the Imp, it will give a valuable in return. It is advised to not give too many shinies to Imps, as they might get tired of them.
pages._comment: Unlocked when the player trades with an Imp

pages.title: Imp Magic
pages.description: Imp Magic is used to make Imps cast fire-related spells at the request of their masters. Craft with a $(item)Demonic Contract$() with the items for the spell, then bound it using a $(item)Taglock Kit$(). Once given to the Imp, it will start casting the spell if their master is not too far away.$(p)Imp Magic effects can be removed by dying or eating a $(item)Frozen Heart$().
pages._comment: Unlocked when a player gives a spell contract to an Imp

pages.title: Demon Hearts
pages.description: Using a $(item)Demon Heart$() on an Imp will cause it to temporarily greatly grow in both size and strength. In this state the Imp cannot trade or perform Imp Magic. Using an $(item)Icy Needle$() on the creature will make it return to their normal size again.
pages._comment: Unlocked when a player uses a Demon Heart on an Imp
